title:
Topological superconductivity in superconducting chiral topological
  semimetals with parallel spin-momentum locking
abstract:
Distinguished from conventional band-inversion-induced Weyl semimetals,
chiral topological semimetals host helicoid-arc surface states originating from
time-reversal invariant momenta of the Brillouin zone. Motivated by the
experimental observation of parallel spin-momentum locking in chiral
topological semimetals, we find that parallel spin-momentum locking leads to
helicoid-arc surface states. We also investigate the potential intrinsic
topological phases in a superconducting chiral topological semimetal with
$s_\pm$- wave pairing. We find that a first-order time-reversal invariant
topological superconductor can host one Majorana cone for closed Fermi
surfaces. Interestingly, there are two Majorana cones when the Fermi surfaces
become open. In addition, a second-order topological superconductor with chiral
Majorana states can be realized in the presence of a mixture of $s\pm$- and
$id$-wave pairing. We show that chiral topological semimetals are fascinating
platforms for exploring intrinsic unconventional superconductivity and
topological superconductivity.
